problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the area of the ABC sector is 76.93 and the angle CBA is vertical to EBD, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (9252.75, 12619.81)
B = (34.23, 34.23)
C = (34.23, 15634.81)
D = (34.23, -17714.01)
E = (-12965.77, -17714.01)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 14))

# Adjust axis limits for better presentation
ax.set_xlim(-19965.77, 20034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-24965.77, 20034.23)

# Draw the gray arc sector (B, A, C)
radius = 15634.81
start_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(A[1] - B[1], A[0] - B[0]))
end_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(C[1] - B[1], C[0] - B[0]))

if start_angle > end_angle:
    end_angle += 360

arc = patches.Wedge(
    center=B,
    r=radius,
    theta1=start_angle,
    theta2=end_angle,
    facecolor="gray",
    edgecolor="black",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(arc)

# Draw the brown triangle (B, D, E)
brown_triangle = patches.Polygon([B, D, E], closed=True, color="saddlebrown", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(brown_triangle)

# Draw right-angle marker at D
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

draw_right_angle(ax, B, D, E)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((D[0] + E[0]) / 2, (D[1] + E[1]) / 2, "13", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="top")
ax.text((B[0] + D[0]) / 2, (B[1] + D[1]) / 2, "22", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The length of the hypotenuse of the BDE triangle is 22 and the length of the side opposite to the EBD angle is 13, so the EBD angle equals $\arcsin(\frac{13}{22}) = \arcsin(0.59) = 36.16$. The angle CBA is vertical to the angle EBD so the degree of the CBA angle = 36.16. The CBA angle of the ABC sector is 36.16 and the area is 76.93 so the BC radius can be computed as $\sqrt{\frac{76.93}{\frac{36.16}{360} * \pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{76.93}{0.1 * \pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{76.93}{0.31}} = \sqrt{248.16} = 15.75$. Therefore the final answer is 15.75.
